Pre-Idea.Explanations: Identify a problem to solve and develop a strategy/idea as a solution
Observing trends, gaps in the market, and unmet needs.
Filtering and focusing on what’s most relevant when there is a vast source of information
This stage is often characterized by high levels of uncertainty, which can be paralyzing and lead to indecision.
Balancing the time spent on passion projects with other responsibilities and commitments

Pre-Idea.Challenges: Lack of Personal Confidence and Motivation
Pre-Idea.Explanations: Lack of an inner drive and belief in one's ability to succeed
Pre-Idea.Prerequisites: Being passionate to work on the problem

Pre-Idea.Explanations: Listening to what's being said and what's not being said, questioning the problem on a different level.
Pre-Idea.Prerequisites: Exposure and attention to the information from all perspectives

Pre-Idea.Explanations: Engaging to conversations and listening to what the problems are
Pre-Idea.Prerequisites: Using available information to problems more deeply

Pre-Idea.Explanations: Understanding the forces at play impacting ones passion.
Converting the observer to someone that adds value to your passion
Seeking individual that have relevent knowledge and experience.
Increase the number of conversations by attending events
Discovering what connects you to the passion project
Discovering what events can bring you the benefit of growth and building supportive relationships
Involve in active decision-making with the stake holders network

Pre-Launch.Explanations: Clearly define and articulate your business idea or concept
Understanding if there is a genuine market need for their idea.
Develop a clear value proposition.
Determining who the target customers are and their characteristics.
Gather insights from potential users to align MVP features with their needs and preferences.
Define and prioritize the core features and functionalities that your MVP will include.
Develop a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) to test the concept with real users.
Develop a comprehensive plan for launching and promoting your product in the market.
Developing a strategy to enter the market and attract early customers.
Developing a strong and recognizable brand from the outset.
Pre-Launch.Prerequisites: clear value,mission and targer audience understanding

Pre-Launch.Explanations: Using personal savings to fund initial operations and working long hours without income which may be demotivating.
Pre-Launch.Prerequisites: Having a strong passion for the business's long term growth

Pre-Launch.Explanations: Choosing the right legal structure and registering the business.
Understanding and complying with relevant regulations.
Identifying and convincing potential cofounders to join the venture and recruiting skilled senior-level team members with limited resources.
Identifying sustainable and scalable revenue models.
Accessing necessary tools, office space, and technology on a budget.
Pre-Launch.Prerequisites: Strategic Long term Planning + Resouce Pulling

Pre-Launch.Explanations: Protecting intellectual property through patents, trademarks, etc. during the MVP creation process and even afterwards.
Overcoming technical hurdles with limited resources.
Attracting interest from angel investors or early stage venture capitalists.
Identifying and analyzing potential competitors.
Finding and applying for grants or startup competitions.
Pre-Launch.Prerequisites: Exposure and attention to relevant information

Pre-Launch.Explanations: Creating effective marketing strategies with minimal budget.

Post-Launch.Explanations: Confirming the product meets customer needs through feedback and testing.
Use feedback from customer validation to make improvements and enhancements to the product.
Research and understand competitors' strengths, weaknesses, strategies, and market positioning.
Develop a comprehensive plan for launching and promoting your product in the market.
Developing a strategy to enter the market and attract early customers.
Post-Launch.Prerequisites: Clear value, mission, and targer audience understanding

Post-Launch.Explanations: Developing a strong and recognizable brand from the outset.
Post-Launch.Prerequisites: Having a strong passion for the business's long term growth

Post-Launch.Explanations: Choosing the right legal structure and registering the business.
Understanding and complying with relevant regulations.
Identifying and convincing potential cofounders to join the venture and recruiting skilled senior-level team members with limited resources.
Identifying sustainable and scalable revenue models.
Accessing necessary tools, office space, and technology on a budget.
Post-Launch.Prerequisites: Strategic Long term Planning + Resouce Pulling

Post-Launch.Explanations: Finding the right channels and strategies for customer acquisition.
Protecting intellectual property through patents, trademarks, etc. during the MVP creation process and even afterwards.
Overcoming technical hurdles with limited resources.
Attracting interest from angel investors or early stage venture capitalists.
Finding and applying for grants or startup competitions.
Post-Launch.Prerequisites: Exposure and attention to relevant information

Post-Launch.Explanations: Understand your revenue forecasts, profit margins, cash flow, and financial needs.
Assess the size of the market, growth opportunities, competitive landscape, and target audience.
Determining a fair valuation for the startup to negotiate with investors.
Post-Launch.Prerequisites: Analyze Financial projections, Evaluating market potential

Post-Launch.Explanations: Providing excellent customer support to build trust and retain customers.
Developing and refining the sales strategy to convert leads into paying customers.
Maintaining transparent and effective communication with investors.
Post-Launch.Prerequisites: Identifying relevant events and reaching out

Post-Launch.Explanations: Efficiently allocating resources to support growth initiatives.
Managing cash flow effectively to ensure the startup can sustain operations until the next funding round.

Growth.Explanations: Confirming the product meets customer needs through feedback and testing.
Use feedback from customer validation to make improvements and enhancements to the product.
Research and understand competitors' strengths, weaknesses, strategies, and market positioning.
Develop a comprehensive plan for launching and promoting your product in the market.
Developing a strategy to enter the market and attract early customers.

Growth.Explanations: Developing a strong and recognizable brand from the outset.

Developing and refining the sales strategy to convert leads into paying customers.

Growth.Explanations: Maintaining transparent and effective communication with investors.
Growth.Prerequisites: Efficiently allocating resources to support growth initiatives.

Growth.Explanations: Efficiently allocating resources to support growth initiatives.
Ensuring that operational capabilities can scale with business growth and that business is adaptable to changing circumstances.
Growth.Prerequisites: Finding Effective Ways of Cutting Costs + Product Improvment

Growth.Explanations: Meeting key milestones and performance metrics to secure continued investor support.
